data.title: Great lunch specials
data.text: Stopped in for lunch to get my sushi fix. Very pleasant service and nice and quiet. Lunch specials offer very reasonable prices for delicious sushi.

data.title: Awesome Sushi!
data.text: We ate at Tsunami tonight, the food is excellent. Ordered some sushi roll, they are all well prepared, out of control roll , sex on the beach roll & bullet roll was fresh and delicious. The service was great, the staff . Great food, great services , will be back soon!!!!

data.title: Average Sushi at Best
data.text: The Charleston area has several great sushi restaurants.  Unfortunately, Tsunami is not one of them.  The sushi is just average.  It is overpriced.  The service is quite poor.  The attitude of the wait staff is even worse.  I will not be back.

owner_response.author: Mount Pleasant T, Manager at Tsunami, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi Tim, sorry about the bad food and service that you experienced, always trying to make our customers satisfied , but obviously we didn't make that happen this time. We deeply want to apologize for the bad experience, but is there anyway you can tell us who is your service and when is date that you dining with us, we really want to improve the mistake we have done, and we really want to do our best to have you back again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very good
data.text: 3 of us had a late dinner here on a Sunday night. We were seated right away as there was hardly anyone there. I was worried at first but my worries were soon calmed when the appetizers were brought out. Everything we ordered was very good, fresh and full of flavor. The service was great and the atmosphere is nice. I'm not sure why it was so empty, maybe the residents of Mt. Pleasant don't eat out after 9 on Sunday nights but this place was really good.

data.title: Sushi!!!!!!!!!!
data.text: The food at this restaurant is wonderful.We had appetizers and sushi, which were great. The food and the service were wonderful.

data.title: Noisy but great food
data.text: The food at this restaurant is wonderful, but I don't understand why there is loud music drowning out the conversation - especially in a Japanese restaurant. We had appetizers and I had the Mongolian beef, which was great. There is plenty to share- the meals are huge. The food and the service were wonderful, but please turn down the music!  I asked for them to do so, which they did for a while, but eventually it was louder than ever!!!  Maybe getting the food to go would work!

data.title: Fresh and creative!
data.text: Fresh and creative sushi at especially good prices during their happy hour 4-7pm. The service was friendly and prompt and the sushi was very high quality. Can't wait to go back!

data.title: Very disappointing
data.text: My family was looking for a great sushi place and was very disappointed. When we arrived the bar was full but the dining room was not. We sat down immediately only to have a slack waiter named George who informed us that the sushi bar was backed up. We decided we were too hungry to leave our mistake. We arrived before 7 when the early bird specials ended so George promptly never came back until after 7.  He never told us about the specials.  It took an hour to receive our foods with no apologies whatsoever.  This restaurant seems to cater to a young bar crowd, not to families with children.

data.title: Good Sushi
data.text: We could not get in to our first choice on a Friday night so we stopped in here . The sushi is good , the eel was great as was the seaweed salad and drinks. I was disappointed they did not have octopus or squid offerings but everything we had was good . Our server (I wish I remembered her name ) was awesome and very quick and efficient . I would eat here again with no hesitation

data.title: One of our favorite places to eat
data.text: Their food is so good that this is a weekly family favorite. Staff is great. Jade is our favorite server there and always remembers exactly what each family member likes as their favorites! She's awesome.

data.title: Good sushi
data.text: Nothing exciting, and nothing to complain about. Good sushi, very good service, quite atmosphere. I'd eat there again.

data.title: Good sushi
data.text: We ate here as a family and sat at the sushi bar. The food was good with a nice variety of sushi and other dishes. Our son loves sushi, but raved about the fried tofu, which was really good! The sushi chef didn't have much to say, and the service was a little slow even though it was past lunch rush, and they weren't very busy. Our server was nice, however.

data.title: WOW
data.text:
I've eaten at many Chinese restaurants. They all have their own local flair. But the entre I ordered at Tsunami was totally over the top. We enjoyed Edamonde, Crab Wontons along with soup and salad. But my choice was OUTSTANDING!
Pineapple fried rice with Beef. Served in the 1/2 Pineapple used to mix with the rice. 
Give it a try, I loved it.

data.title: Quiet and Filling
data.text: We had just arrived from Atlanta and I love Japanese food. The California roll was excellent as was the Miso soup. The beef stir fry appetizer was large enough for a meal and the Hibachi chicken was good. They make a good yum yum sauce which I am very finicky about and I loved it. And with the restaurant behind our hotel that made it even better.

data.title: Bad Sushi
data.text: We ordered the sushi while sitting in the lounge. The service is not really that good. The Bartender stood behind the bar and talked with 2 guys for the entire 2 hours we were visiting. We had to ask for almost everything... The rice served with their sushi falls apart. I've never seen sushi fall apart before. The portions are also smaller than are the portions served at near by sushi restaurants. That being said; the rice falling apart really killed the fun of enjoying sushi.

data.title: Uneven experience
data.text:
The first cocktail was supposed to be a key lime, tasted like straight sake, second one the waitress made was fantastic. Husband happy with beers, and warm sake.
Pot stickers and teriyaki chicken were delicious. But entree was not for me and I understand I am picky eater, I did not complain, just ate veggies and rice and returned the entire plate of chicken with out a word from the waitress. My husband ate his whole Neal and said it was okay. Jade brought me ice cream for my birthday : )
Only beers and appetizers next time.

data.title: What's that smell
data.text:
The first go around my food was greasy.  I sent it back and got a triple Tuna roll.  It is good but
Hard to eat due to the weird smell of the restaurant.   I won't be coming back because of
The stitch.   It's pretty gross.

data.title: Love the sushi
data.text: I recently ordered more sushi than I could comfortably eat, but it was delicious.  The crispy shrimp roll was particularly excellent.

data.title: Great sushi!!!
data.text: Great sushi restaurant , happy hour menu had lot of great deal to choice from. Serving sushi & hibachi and some other fusion dishes. Right next to cinemas , great spot to hang out with...

data.title: Hayley is wonderful
data.text: They have the best Happy Hour sushi in Mt pleasant.  1/2 off apps and cheap wine.  4-7pm.  The only thing we, I should say someone I was with just didn't like the new ginger dressing on the house salad. Please bring the old one back. it was the best dressing in town.
